review.title: Our stay at the Loews Regency.
review.reviewText: We absolutely loved our stay. The staff was very professional, they made sure that were well accomodated. In special, Chris the manager, that did all in his power to make sure our needs were met. Definitely 5 stars.
The service was great when we checked in. The room service was timely and the food quality was great. The room view was outstanding.
review.negativeRemarks: The view terrace had no seating.
review.locationRemarks: The Wayfare tavern has awesome fried chicken. Several good bars within a few blocks.

review.title: Wonderful San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: We truly enjoyed Loews Regency and will definitely return. The attention to detail at the hotel is excellent. We arrived just in time to have a glass of wine on their 40th floor observation deck which has beautiful sweeping views of the city and bay. The views from the room were beautiful. The room itself had a very open feel to it. It was clean, comfortable and well appointed. We ended up eating in the restaurant and were very pleasantly surprised. We were expecting good food, but not great food. Our dinner was among the best we have had in San Francisco, and we have had a lot of excellent meals there. The staff was excellent. Everyone was very pleasant and eager to help make our stay even better. Their little touches from the ice bucket being filled with fresh ice prior to us arriving in our room, to the flower packets in your car when you leave all helped make the experience wonderful.

review.title: Nice city/bridge view.
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was Awesome... They made my 18th Wedding Anniversary memorable.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Anonymous on Expedia,

Thank you for your positive review and your compliments about our friendly staff, location and amenities. We hope to welcome you back to this beautiful city by the bay again soon.

Sincerely yours,

Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.reviewText: Value on par with location, amenities, friendly staff, room.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Anonymous on Expedia,

Thank you for your "fantastic bridge to bride view room" review. We're delighted to hear that Loews Regency San Francisco is one of your favorite hotels and happy to hear that you had a wonderful time with us.  We also appreciate your compliments about our friendly team members, location and amenities. Please come back and visit us again soon.

Sincerely yours,

Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.title: Famtastic Bridge to Bridge View Room
review.reviewText:
Very welcoming staff.  Room was large, super comfortable and luxurious bedding and AMAZING views.
One of my favorite rooms in SF

managementResponses.response:
Dear Steve on Expedia,

Thank you for taking the time to share with us your wonderful review. We’re delighted to hear that you had an amazing stay on the 44th floor along with the breathtaking views.  Your kind words about our team members and the hotel facilities are very much appreciated! We certainly look forward to your next visit to this beautiful city by the bay when you visit San Francisco again! 

Sincerely yours,

Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.title: must be the best view in the city
review.reviewText: Our room was on the 44th floor (of 48) and all rooms are high.  We had a city view king rather than a bay view, but you get both views from the sky bridge anyway.  The view is dramatic, all the way to the Golden Gate Bridge (if its not foggy)  and only for guests!  The hotel itself has a more residential apartments feel than a hotel, with little in the way of lobby/bars etc and its all very quiet.  The furniture and fittings are a little dated in places, but the bed was very comfy,  it was very clean and room service was lightening fast.  Staff were all helpful and overall it felt like a well run and welcoming place.  Each Friday and Saturday at 5pm they offer free drinks to residents on the 40th floor terrace.  Its worth going to take in the views and that bracing San Francisco breeze!  - on the downside, if its foggy in town you are so high up you cant see the ground...
review.positiveRemarks: That view,  and the professional service.
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district so limited dining options close by at the weekend.  But its all walking distance.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Craig,

Thank you for taking the time to share with us your positive review and we are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the views from your room and also had a great time here with us. We hope to see you back again soon.

Sincerely yours,
Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.title: Worth the little extra for the views.
review.reviewText: Excellent from very friendly staff to room. Have stayed at the Wynn in Las Vegas and the room is as nice. Had a variety of pillows for sleeping and didn't have those useless decorative pillows. Housekeeping was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern updated all the amenities
review.negativeRemarks: no
review.locationRemarks: very good for our purposes

managementResponses.response:

Thank you for your positive feedback and we are delighted to hear that you had a wonderful time with us.  Thanks you for your kind words about our team members and we hope to see you back again soon.

Sincerely yours,

Austin P.

review.reviewText: Great location, close to all activities. Staff treated us like family, we have not been more happy like this at any other place. Rooms and facility were spotless.

review.title: Loews SF
review.reviewText: Excellent attention to detail by professional staff. It hasn't changed greatly in appearance since the takeover from Mandarin Oriental.
review.positiveRemarks: The views are superb from this hotel. The staff are superb.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel would benefit enormously from having an upgraded, destination bar and restaurant on the ground floor. The ground floor lacks character.
review.locationRemarks: Near so much in SF - walking distance to the Ferry Building, waterfront, North beach, Soma and more.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Anonymous on Expedia,

Sincerely yours,

Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.title: best view in san fran.
review.reviewText: the friendliest staff I've seen in awhile, made the stay a very personal experience. the view would have been enough to forgive any short comings but they were spot on from concierge to the driver. we stayed at a 5 star hotel in Napa the next weekend and we were just part of the masses. we will be going back to loews next time we stay in san francisco.

managementResponses.response:
Dear steveandsonya on Expedia,

Thank you for taking the time to share with us this wonderful review.  We’re glad to hear that you had a great time here in San Francisco and that our staff took very good care of you during your recent visit.  We also thank you for your compliments about our hotel car service and your thoughtful words about our team members.  Your recommendation to stay at the Loews Regency San Francisco is very much appreciated!  A repeat guest is sure one of our favorite compliments and we hope to see you back again soon.

Sincerely yours,

Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.title: Fantastic Hotel!
review.reviewText: Everything perfect from check in to check out. Many thanks to Chris at front desk and the doormen including wonderful Eduardo (who is the loveliest man), Michael and Maurio. They do an amazing job - always happy, friendly, welcoming and helpful.  We appreciated late check out (we had a late International flight) and use of hotel facilities until we departed for airport. Room was AMAZING.  Incredible views from the Bridge to Bridge room.  I agree with other reviews - pay the extra and book this room, you will not be disappointed. Housekeeping do a wonderful job, room spotlessly clean and always stocked with high quality amenities and complimentary water - with chocolates at turndown.  We chose to have two dinners in room (5 night stay) as we had the best view in San Francisco. Dinner was fanastic and exceeded our expectations.  We also used the house car, this is a great extra provided by the hotel and the drivers provide wonderful service and are very knowledgable re the Bay Area. The staff at this hotel are exceptional, some of the best service we have received. They are professional and knowledgable and somehow manage to create a 'boutique' hotel experience in a large, luxury hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Amazing service plus incredible views with large spotlessly clean room and bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Website and pre booking (if you need to email reservations) can be a bit tricky when booking outside of the US but worth the effort.
review.locationRemarks: Great, central and safe location.  Easy access to most tourist attractions.  Quick walk to Ferry Building, Embarcadero and Union Square.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Lizzy,

Thank you for posting this positive review and your compliments about the views from your room.  Sorry to hear about the limited dinner menu due to remodeling of the kitchen.  We look forward to welcoming you back to this beautiful city by the bay.

Sincerely yours,

Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.title: Very cozy and comfortable, conveniently located
review.reviewText:
We loved staying here, didn't want to leave.
Every time we came in we had a warm greeting. The breakfast was good, but dinner menu was very limited due to remodeling of the kitchen. Exceptional view from our room.

managementResponses.response:

Thank you for taking the time to share feedback regarding your recent stay with us.  It is never pleasant to hear that we did not exceed our guest’s expectations but I appreciate your willingness to share your thoughts and feelings.  Your comments are valuable and we will use them to continuously improve and enhance our guests’ experiences.  We hope that we will have an opportunity to welcome you back again.
 
Sincerely yours,
 
Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.title: Overrated
review.reviewText: Overrated!!! Was very disappointing with the amenities, and the  parking is limited and expensive; $68 a day and only valet. I was disappointed with the overall rating that had been reviewed and submitted. I would not rate this hotel as a 5 star. Definitely a 4 star rating because of the location, staff and room size. However, only a 3 star rating due to lack of amenities and parking. Did not even have complimentary coffee in the rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The view from the room
review.negativeRemarks: Need a better fitness room. Need more amenities (swimming pool, complimentary coffee in the room, etc)
review.locationRemarks: Great location

managementResponses.response:
Dear Ann,

Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us.  We’re glad to hear that you had an amazing stay at our bridge to bridge junior suite, the spectacular views from your room and your compliments about our team members.  We’re very sorry to hear that you did not get to experience a massage during your last stay. We hope that you will get to pamper yourself at our Spa when you return to San Francisco again.  We look forward to your next visit soon.

My best,

Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.title: bay view rooms best in town
review.reviewText:
hotel was nice but somewhat dated, mostly the bathrooms. from our bay view, bridge to bridge room, the views were spectacular.
i had hoped to get a massage and more from the spa.  it was advertised heavily in the rooms and in the hallways.  it never opened that day with no real explanation from the front desk as to why. (i don't think they knew.)
concierge was great.  turn down service was lovely.

review.title: As good as it gets, plus THE VIEW.
review.reviewText: I dare you to find a better hotel in SF with a view.

review.reviewText: You can catch the Cable Cars a half a block away. 10 minute walk and you're at the Ferry Building.

photos.caption: Lounge area in Jr. King Suite

review.title: Stayed at Loews Regency Memorial Day weekend
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Loews Regency hotel for Memorial Day weekend. I traveled with my husband and chose this hotel because of location, ranking on TripAdvisor and amenities. We were not disappointed. We had a Jr. Suite with a Golden Gate view which was to die for on the 39th floor. My husband used the gym and thought it was more up-to-date than the Planet Fitness facility he uses at home. The business center is small but serviceable. The hotel staff was fantastic and their recommendation for dining, day excursions, travel route, even parking was always spot on and invaluable. Given our short stay, we needed to bat 1000 on all that we did and working with the hotel staff helped us achieve that goal. I would surely return to the Loews Regency if I get the opportunity to travel to San Francisco again and I'll definitely recommend this hotel to all my family and friends.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room views and staff
review.negativeRemarks: Pricing. I know it's San Francisco and everything is outrageously priced... but better pricing never hurts.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf-ate at Scoma's. Went to Sonoma-Artesa Vineyards and Winery. Dine at Tadish Grill. Had breakfast to Sears Fine Foods on Powell.

review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, people are nice and very friendly!  Nice views and very clean! Only thing is make sure your room isn't by the elevators, spent both nights I was there trying really hard to sleep, elevators are really loud! Sounds like a train passing by! All day and night long!

review.title: Fabulous views of Bay Bridge at night!
review.reviewText: Used Expedia points to book this fantastic hotel located in the heart of SF Financial District. 40th floor deluxe King room with unbelievable views of San Francisco. Very comfortable bed & pillows. Great service from front desk and valet parking staff. Larger than expected room size. Well stocked mini-bar (pricey). Located walking distance to A LOT of really great restaurants (Belden Street).
review.positiveRemarks: The views from the bay side room and financial district location.
review.negativeRemarks: Could use a night light in the bathroom. Very dark and the only choice is "full on" bathroom lights... not great for soaking in the tub.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of great restaurants...all walking distance.

review.title: Superior service, exceptional facilities
review.reviewText: The staff was extraordinary from the minute we walked in the door.  At first we hesitated not he financial district location for a Valentine's Day weekend, but we are very glad we chose this hotel.  We walked every where we wanted to go.  The Embarcadero, art galleries, Chinatown, North Beach.  Our room had a bridge-to-bridge view that could not be beat.  This hotel exceeded our high expectations!

review.title: Great night view
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location, awesome night view for the bay and the staff is really nice, the food was great, service room quick, only two things on negative: not so soft towels and few options on the menu to eat.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Cindy,
Thank you for taking the time to post this delightful review! We appreciate your compliments about our hotel guest rooms, restaurant and service staff. We are thrilled to hear that you had a good night sleep as we often hear from our guests that our beds are super comfortable. We look forward to your return visit soon to this beautiful city by the bay.

review.title: Exquisite Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Spacious rooms, very clean & turn down service with chocolates. The bed & pillows were the most comfortable I've ever slept on! Incredible view! Room service very expensive...may want to get your morning coffee elsewhere. Food in the hotel restaurant was delicious! Fresh bottles of water provided daily.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, lovely & spacious rooms. Hotel staff very efficient and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Have coffee available in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district not a lot to do as a tourist. Very easy to get a taxi or Uber to get to a tourist's destination.

review.reviewText:
Very poor service
Unsafe , as guest we use their valet n overnite parking

So not 5 star

Rooms too small upgrade too expensive

review.title: Best view
review.reviewText: Over all good . Good concierge and staff . Very good bathrooms . The best view

review.title: Excellent All-Around Experience
review.reviewText: From the moment we walked through the door, the service given to us was a 10.  Excellent staff, knowledgeable concierge, & relaxing rooms.  This was my first stay at a Loews property, I will definitely be looking for a Loews property whenever we travel.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to shopping, restaurants, and the views.

review.title: Great staff and comfortable room but why....
review.reviewText: Nice room and amazing staff but they put us in a handicapped room with a tiny shower with icky shower curtain. The hotel was empty on a weekend and I even asked about the room and was given no other option. This seemed like a penalty for booking through Expedia. Be very careful if you book this through a third party.

review.title: Not worth the pricetag.
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for an anniversary trip.  I was excited because the views looked amazing.  That is about the only thing that is.  Our room was not cleaned well upon arrival and that continued throughout the stay.  Nothing to rave about.  I've stayed at many hotels and for almost $600 a night, I would expect better.  There wasn't even a coffee pot in the room.

review.title: Nice, but not for the price
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean, good location, friendly staff. But for the price I paid, I expected something a bit more luxurious! Odd room layout and a bit outdated. I would stay here again if the price was right (like a 2-for-1 deal!).

review.title: Our old love, anew....
review.reviewText: We stayed here when it was the Mandarin Oriental in 1991 for our short, but sweet wedding weekend. We have stayed away since because it became so expensive that we were loathe to spend the money. I looked at it again for our 24th anniversary and since Loews took over 5 months ago they have lowered the price as well. We were very pleased to stay here again...THE best views of any hotel we've been to in the City, but that being said...our only complaint was that the windows were really dirty and that unfortunate fact make it harder to appreciate the spectacular view, a bit of a let down....
review.positiveRemarks: Most everything, but we do wish they had more than one complimentary car for their customers, we never did get to enjoy that perk!
review.negativeRemarks: The complimentary car availability and clean windows.
review.locationRemarks: It is a great location to walk most places (during the day) in this wonderful city, we love it, we'll be back.

review.title: Great location with a wonderful view.
review.reviewText: In San Francisco for the week end. The room was great.  We slept very well.  The staff was efficient, friendly and knew our names. We ordered room service twice and the food was excellent.  Very pleased we stayed there.
review.positiveRemarks: See above.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.reviewText: It's one of the best hotels  ,  it has all the five-star service

managementResponses.userNickname: Austin P. Director of Sales & Marketing
managementResponses.response:
Dear Bryce, 
It was wonderful to read your review and thank you for sharing your experience at Loews Regency San Francisco.  We’re delighted that you had a great time with us during your recent visit and we agree that our views are the best in the city. Please come back and see us agian soon.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: We came out for my birthday, and simply wanted to stay in one of the best hotels in S.F. We really enjoyed our stay here, but thought that the rooms left a bit to be desired. The views were good, and we were on the 29th floor, but they certainly would have been better had they bumped us up a little bit further.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was incredible. They remembered mine and my girlfriend's names the entire time of our stay. Made us feel very welcome.
review.negativeRemarks: The room. It was nice, but definitely could use a slightly more upgraded finish to it.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great! We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to. Used Uber or public transport to get wherever else we needed.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Anonymous,

Thank you for staying with us and we are delighted to know that you had a wonderful time at Loews Regency San Francisco.  Our team members are very passionate about what they do and they do their best to enhance each guest’s experience.  We certainly look forward to seeing you soon.

Sincerely,
Austin P.
Director of Sales & Marketing

review.reviewText: Great hotel & ALL the employees were super nice & very helpful:-)

managementResponses.response:
Dear Star on Expedia,

Thank you for staying at Loews Regency San Francisco.  We have noted on your comments and we will use them to continue to improve our products and services. We do hope that you try us again in the future.  Sincerely, Austin P. Director of Sales & Marketing

review.reviewText: The room does not have a coffee maker and the mattress was uncomfortable.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Sunil,

It was such a pleasure reading your wonderful review and we are truly happy to hear that you had a good experience here at Loews Regency San Francisco.   We couldn’t agree more that the views from the rooms are amazing and it’s also one of our best selling points of the hotel.   Your kind words will be shared with our team members.  Thank you once again for staying with us and we certainly look forward to seeing you back at Loews Regency San Francisco soon. My best, Austin P. Director of Sales & Marketing

review.title: Excellent view of the city
review.reviewText: This hotel has a beautiful all-round view of the city. The service and staff are fantastic. I really enjoyed the comfortable setting and amenities in the room. The bed linen is very high thread count, the mattress and pillows are very comfortable. My favorite part was the visit to the spa. It is a very peaceful and well designed spa. The parking garage is in the hotel basement and very quick to access.
review.positiveRemarks: Spa, service and staff. Good restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Better mini-bar.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located in the center of the business district. Most of the main attractions of San Francisco are accessible quickly.

review.title: hidden gem
review.reviewText: close to embarcadero, fab views and super comfy beds!

review.title: Wonderful View
review.reviewText: All the hotel rooms are above the 38th floor. It is in the third tallest building in San Francisco. You're pretty much guaranteed a good view. I also thought the huge bathroom are excellent.

review.title: Anniversary in SF
review.reviewText: my husband spent our anniversary here for one night. After catching lunch at pier 39 we checked in and were pleasantly surprised to find we were upgraded to a King City View room. Once we got to our room we were amazed at the cleanliness and overall quietness of the hotel. The room was awesome with a great view of Market Street and Twin Peaks. The Bathroom was huge and very well lit. The bed was so comfortable that I ended up taking a two hour nap once I laid on it. We ordered room service for both dinner and breakfast the next morning. It was well worth the splurge and the food was fantastic. We'll definitely be going back to this hotel and hopefully take advantage of their gym and spa services.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with friendly staff!
review.reviewText: Overall San Fran was fantastic. We stayed in the financial district, which can be a bit tricky for restaurant options. There are so many ways to get everywhere it can be a little confusing . The hotel was wonderful. The staff was fantastic. They arranged a rental car for us with no issues. They were more than willing to help.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was classy and elegant.
review.locationRemarks: Financial district closes down after 5. If you plan to eat or drink at one of the open restaurants make sure you make reservations!

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco's Financial District
review.reviewText: We traveled to San Francisco for a short vacation and were blown away by the views from our room and the glassed walkway between the two hotel towers.  Lots of San Franciscan things to do and see.  China Town, the Embarcadero, the Cable Cars, access to the Ferries for bay cruises, Alcatraz and Sausalito, and fine dining were all within reasonable walking distance.  Really enjoyed it.
review.positiveRemarks: Beside the great views and locale, the staff were very friendly and efficient and the concierge service was the very best I can imagine.
review.negativeRemarks: Well, if the accommodations were free it would have been much better.  However, it was sill my best hotel experience ever.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in San Francisco's Financial District and China Town, the Embarcadero, the Cable Cars, access to the Ferries for bay cruises, Alcatraz an

review.title: More than expected!
review.reviewText: Greeted by the door man then by the front desk. Staff went beyond the call of duty to be sure our stay was superb.  The room was amazing.  The view was so majestic. We have stayed at many high end luxurious hotels and this is ranked right up there with them.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, cleanliness of the room.  The showers were just awesome.  Awesome views from the 46th floor.
review.locationRemarks: Just a few blocks from Fisherman's wharf.  Local eateries nearby.

review.title: Beautiful view
review.reviewText: Expensive but at least it is worth it.  Convenient location

review.title: Attentive service
review.reviewText: Spent two nights. An unassuming hotel entrance with a tasteful but small check in desk.  Quickly had my room upgraded and the concierge Michael was phenomenal. Every restaurant he recommended was better than the one before. The staff was calling me by name on the first day. Centrally located. Had a car for me within a hour.  Gorgeous room with every detail perfect. Breakfast was excellent
review.positiveRemarks: Personal service and quality of rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, Cable car is half a block away, Golden gate bridge, Fisherman's Wharf and China Town

review.title: Amazing view of the city
review.reviewText: The people at this hotel really take care of you.  They've thought about what you may need before you even become aware of it yourself.
review.positiveRemarks: The view.  The attention to detail.  Everything was clean, cared for well, and ordered perfectly.  The staff was courteous and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: About 4 blocks from the Ferry building in the financial district.  A short drive to the Ballpark.  A short walk to Union Square and Chinatown.

review.reviewText: Friendly staff, great hotel and  convenient location

review.title: Very Old Hotel
review.reviewText:
The elevator doesn't function well.
the room doesn't has space for the clothes.
really I think it is very expense for what you get. I didn't like it in any way.
review.positiveRemarks: the personnel

review.title: Expensive hotel that doesn't provide free wifi
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located. The staff is pleasant and well trained. The rooms are comfortable exactly the way you expected from an expensive hotel.The view from the room is breathtaking .  There's no free internet available though. I didn't get it because I thought was insulting that they want make an extra buck when I had pay handsomely for my stay. I would suggest that they  include the internet fee to the room price.
review.positiveRemarks: location and view
review.negativeRemarks: internet availability
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero, trolley ride to Golden Gate Park, Chinatown

review.title: Spectacular views, great location
review.reviewText: Appreciate the early check in; pleasant staff; extremely accommodating
review.positiveRemarks: Location; access; cleanliness; friendly staff; great customer service
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful views; close to everything

review.reviewText: Just an ordinary room. Nothing that will make you want to return.

review.title: Great hotel with amazing views!
review.reviewText: We stayed there for our anniversary and really enjoyed the beautiful views of the bay.  The staff was really helpful and congratulated us on our anniversary every time we talked to them.  They even sent chocolate covered strawberries and champagne to our room!  We look forward to visiting again soon.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Great staff. Very expensive, high end. Gorgeous views. Nice bar.
review.positiveRemarks: Room had an amazing view
review.locationRemarks: heart of financial disrtict- right close to North Beach area

review.title: Lovely Hotel with Great Views
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was fantastic.  The entrance, lobby, and restaurant were all very nice.  There are only 2 elevators, and they have a long way to travel, so we felt that we waited a significant time for elevators.  The room was very comfortable, with amazing mattress, sheets, pillows, and blankets.  The shower had great water pressure, and the bathroom was well designed.  Overall, we thought the room was great.  The view (bay side) was absolutely amazing, and worth the visit on its own.  All in all, you won't be disappointed with this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: We enjoyed almost every aspect of this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure how to improve, but we waited for a long time for elevators, especially during social events when there were crowds trying to move around.
review.locationRemarks: Great location downtown.

review.title: staff helpful
review.reviewText:
A wonderful weekend getaway location
We will saty here on out next Bay Area trip

review.title: Another fantastic, albeit expensive stay!
review.reviewText:
Best rooms (Mandarin Bay Bridge Room), best staff, great location, near perfect facilities (small bar and restaurant with a limited menu, no sauna, steam or jacuzzi in spa and no soaking tubs for two in premium rooms) made for another great stay at the MO.  After contemplating how we would feel being on the 44th floor and having an earthquake, guess what?  WE DID--reportedly a 6.0 at 3am!  Given that my wife had just become a Certified Tantra Educator and Dakini, when the bed starting moving I thought it was just her extraordinary energy and powers, but nope, it was a quake!!!

Despite the areas for improvement noted above and the outrageous price of drinks in the bar, we can't imagine staying anywhere else in SF and booking through anyone else but Expedia considering that our room was $200 below the MO published price!
review.positiveRemarks: See above
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Everything in SF is within walking distance!

review.title: Friendly staffs
review.reviewText: Our family really enjoyed our stay. First and foremost, the staffs are friendly. Secondly, it is close to shopping areas and other food chains. Lastly, the hotel is very clean. However, we only wish that the internet should be free of charge.

review.title: San Francisco retreat
review.reviewText: Elegant, calming decor. Very comfortable bed. Unsurpassable city views. Unpretentious staff.

review.title: The Best of The Best
review.reviewText: Absolutely one of the nicest hotels we have stayed at. The views from the 46th floor are spectacular. The service is great as well a the food. Great location in the Financial District and not far from the shopping around Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern comfortable design in rooms with Euorpean bed linens
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing to improve
review.locationRemarks: Close to the financial district and within walking distance of the major shopping areas at Union.

review.reviewText:
i was very happy stay at hotel.
they was so nice.
thank you so much.

review.title: Elegant and Great Staff
review.reviewText: I would rate it one of the best hotels in San Francisco. Staff was extremely attentive. Would stay there again.

review.title: Walking distance to Pier 39 and Ferry Building...
review.reviewText: Parking is too expensive. There is no free Wi-Fi anywhere.

review.title: Not quite up to par
review.reviewText:
Besides being in the Financial District, which is dead on weekends, the location is good.
My main complaint is the design and decor. There really is no lobby now that it is taken up by the bar and restaurant.
That makes the hotel seem much less luxurious.
Our room had a beautiful view, but the furnishings are an odd combination of traditional and Ikea style cabinets and desks. Cheap and out of place in a hotel of this caliber. Also, we could hear talking from the next room through the door to the adjoining room. It was so loud it woke both of us up at 4 in the morning!
Staff were good and very pleasant.

review.title: its a Great Hotel
review.reviewText: the staff was very kind and helpful, and the hotel was fabulous, I plan on returning for my Birthday, and the food was the best Hotel food I ever had.
review.positiveRemarks: Kind Staff, Great Food, and the view from my room was nice
review.locationRemarks: Farmers market and the restaurants near by

review.title: Incredible view
review.reviewText:
The staff was wonderful went the extra step to make us feel welcome for our wedding anniversary!!!
From now on only Mandarin Oriental will be our choice hotel. The bed, pillows and linnen was to die
For, could have stayed in bed all day! Room service was expensive but worth the price for the
Comfort of staying in and enyoing the extraordinary view. Highly recommend the hotel!!!
review.locationRemarks: Great public transportation around. Buy the Weekly pass or daily pass.

review.title: great view of the water & fireworks
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay, helped by cheerfully pleasant, competent and helpful staff. Nice, well appointed room, clean, very quiet. Bay view was very welcome on July 4th, with a perfect view over the fireworks.
review.positiveRemarks: location, view, subtle charm

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Absolutely sets the standard in everything. The place to stay in SF!

review.title: 5 star hotel.
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff at reception. Very professional! Breakfast on Sunday morning at hotel restaurant was dissapointing. Unattentive service was unacceptable. Had to ask for coffee three times.

review.title: San Francisco Mandarin
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff and great views from the room. My only complaint is Wi-Fi is not included and will cost $5/hr or $15/day.
review.positiveRemarks: Exceptional service...and the staff know your name once you've checked in.
review.negativeRemarks: Charging for Internet / wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: Heart of he financial district

review.title: NOT WORTH THE PRICE
review.reviewText: Nice place but not worth $500 a night. And byt he way....we are stilllll waitting for our "complimentary tea."
review.positiveRemarks: View
review.negativeRemarks: Service fees....everything had a 15% add on
review.locationRemarks: most activities within walking distance

review.title: AC was not working. Poor customer service
review.reviewText: We choose to stay here for a nice weekend in San Francisco. Room was appointed in the last floor as requested with spectacular views with excellent amenities, etc. just the way you expect to get from this Company. However, the room was too warm in the evening and called the technician at midnight but didn't repair the problem. We couldn't sleep because the A/C was not working and the room got really warm in the middle of the night. At check out we brought this matter and they couldn't offer any discount or adjustment or refund and they will check later with the technical department to see what happened. In the meantime, I was charged for the overnight valet parking and additional charges. Service at front desk was not as expected and unacceptable. No one contact us yet.
review.positiveRemarks: Good and quiet location. Great toiletries, fantastic view
review.negativeRemarks: services.
review.locationRemarks: quiet and central

photos.caption: Transamerica Building and Alcatraz in the distance.

review.title: Very nice, quiet, ultra friendly hotel!
review.reviewText:
The staff is incredibly personable and friendly. Our room was a bit delayed and we were treated to a complimentary cocktail/appetizer. The view from our 38th floor room was stunning. Quiet room, and very comfortable bed. The pillows were a bit large and stiff, but i should have brought our own from home. Room service menu for dinner does not offer a lot, and we weren't impressed with the steaks. However, we more than made up for it the next night dining at Bob's Steak and Chop House located around the corner in the Omni Hotel.

Our first time in San Francisco to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. So if you're looking for quiet and very nice, this would be a place to consider.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Limited dinner menu for room service.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the cable cars and muni buses, so easy to get around. The hotel doorman was always helpful calling us a cab when we wanted one.

review.title: Great for a family or a business stay.
review.reviewText: Great for a family stay and short walk to the waterfront.

review.title: Couple get away
review.reviewText: Hotel was still in a renovation period, not all hotel options available ..

review.title: Wicked Weekend
review.reviewText: Hotel was fantastic, views were stunning, staff were the most polite and helpfull I have ever had.

review.title: A gem in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with modern rooms, a superb staff of people (how many hotels does the door man address you by your name?) great views from bay side rooms, hotel's restaurant food was as good as neighboring restaurants, a Gem downtown S.F.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bed, views, staff
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant needs more separation from lobby, meaning more privacy, but this is a small issue
review.locationRemarks: California St & Sansome ...central downtown, easy to get street cars, BART or Muni

review.title: Attitude and service makes up for the remodeling.
review.reviewText: There is remodeling that keeps the main entrance and main lobby off limits. This was made up for by the courtesy and professionalism of the staff. Views from our room were imcomparable and worth it. Mandarin has the BEST location in the city for ready access to public transport.
review.locationRemarks: 200 yards from BART and Cable Car on California Street make it a perfect location.

review.title: Emperor's Welcome
review.reviewText: Though the Oriental was undergoing major lobby rennovations this weekend, which made for an awkward entrance and a make-shift registration room, the whole staff was top notch. The food and in-room service was superior. Kindness and promptness exuded from everyone. As a member of the LGBT community visiting with my husband, we felt welcome and were attended to as if we were Emperors. Would I go back? Without a doubt. Thank you MO of SF.
review.positiveRemarks: The view, the elegant room, the food, the service
review.negativeRemarks: The awkward check-in, but that is only temporary.
review.locationRemarks: Optimal to all things SF.

review.title: Best Service
review.reviewText: The staff here is top notch. They are very attentive and their service is incredible.

review.title: Paid for the best but didn't get it
review.reviewText: This was our first five star hotel outside of Las Vegas and we expected a lot, especially for the price. The service was wonderful but the quality of the room and facility was not up to par. Nearly every piece of furniture in our room was dinged up and the upholstery was stained. Sure, it looks like the picture, but age it 15 years. Still, the bathroom was fabulous and the bed was comfortable (no stains there) and it was very quiet way up on the 41st floor. The view was also great, particularly from the "skywalk" area in the hallway on each floor. Since we had paid for the upgraded room with the special theme furniture the shoddy condition of the furnishings was extra disappointing. Was it a good hotel with great service? Yes. Did it feel like a luxury hotel? Not really. Not when you're sitting on a scratched up chaise lounge and putting your jacket down on a stained cushion. Finally, one minor ding. Our room had an ice bucket but there were no ice machines or vending on the floor.

review.title: Customer Services - outstanding
review.reviewText:
Thoroughly satisfied with customer services. Very efficient , discreet and helpful.
The rooms somewhat outdated.

review.title: Terrific Service
review.reviewText: Within minutes of checking into the hotel, everyone there knows your name. Friendly and super courteous staff is the strongest point of this hotel.

review.title: MAndarin Good again
review.reviewText: Good place

review.title: Great service, even better views
review.reviewText: This hotel is very well located in downtown SF. The service is top notch and we got an excellent room with panoramic views of the city and the bay. I recommend it to anyone on a business trip.

review.title: it's a nice hotel but
review.reviewText: I always pick well known brand hotels for my vacations..Mandarin Hotel has a very nice bay view,staff is nice,location is very good.they have no connections between room service and room cleaning service.Every day they left the dirty tea cups and coffee maker also they never put new tea bags.

review.title: One of the best hotels in SF
review.reviewText: everything was perfect.

review.title: Honeymoon
review.reviewText: Best hotel in San Fransisco.

review.title: Can't wait to return.
review.reviewText: The room was well-appointed. The bed was extremely comfortable. The views are insanely gorgeous.

review.title: Worth the price for a special occasion!
review.reviewText:
Great hotel with spectacular views of the bay.
We had a room on the 48th (top) floor with views of the bay bridge and most of the bay. We were celebrating our 20th Anniversary, the staff went out of their way to make it special for us!
Room service was excellent, the staff was very proffesional.
Great suggestions from Consierge for Dinner and sight seeing!
Tadich Grill is just around the corner and worth the wait!

review.title: San Francisco in style
review.reviewText:
We arrived and were immediately greeted by the hotel staff who parked our car, took our bags and welcomed us to the hotel. Our room was on the 42nd floor. There's an glass enclosed walkway which offers great views from both sides. If you hate heights, you probably won't like this hotel because all the rooms start on the 30 something floor.

The room was extremely comfortable. We stayed 5 nights. I felt a real sense of warmth and friendliness from the staff. They were all very helpful and accomodating. I miss the nightly Jasmine tea they'd send up in this little basket along with the wonderful almond cookies. Based on our experiences, we would book Mandarin-Oriental again in a heartbeat.

review.title: We will be back
review.reviewText: Excellent and they got the table at the right restaurant.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: San Francisco's BEST hotel. The hotel staff couldn't be more accommodating. My husband and I were extremely satisfied.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Expensive, but very nice and the views are absolutely incredible!

review.title: Mandarin Orientale
review.reviewText: The staff and service was what you'd expect from a five star hotel, attentive and gracious. The room was quite small although clean. Although we had neighbors room noise was minimal so enjoyed peaceful sleep. The bed was quite comfortable but the controls for the t.v. was confusing to this senior citizen. The hotel is situated close to China Town and in walking distance. The area seemed quite safe during the day but I'd not walk around anywhere in SF at night. I was plesantly surprised NOT to find street people in the near vicinity. BART is a couple of blocks away so travel is simple. The hotel had a parking special so we did not have to pay the $50.00/day usual charge. We had a nice time and would not hesitate to go there again but next time we'll opt for a bigger room.

review.title: Great View!
review.reviewText: Stayed for the first time for my Husband's 40th bday... though the room seemed rather small for the price (Bay View King room) you can't beat the view! I thought about staying at the Ritz, but with only 8 floors it is a far cry from the 41st floor that we were on while at the Mandarin. You will not be disappointed. We had some minor issues with our in-room breakfast service, but overall it was nice to sit there in the morning, drink Ghiradelli hot chocolate, and take in the sunny view of the bay. We also enjoyed the highly acclaimed Mandarin High Tea while we were there - definitely delicious! A must for anyone staying there for the first time. Overall, I would definitely go back and recommend it to family and friends. The service is great and what you would expect from a 5 star hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Simply a great hotel.

review.title: As Expected
review.reviewText: Get a bay-view suite. It is worth it. Hotel located at a good location that is within walking distance to attractions.

review.title: Spectacular
review.reviewText: The Mandarin is near the Bart and easy to get to from the Airport. I special requested a room on the 48th floor for my 48th Birthday and recieved a complementary upgrade to a Bay View room. The room was nicely deocorated in an elegant asian style with spectacular views. The staff was ultra accomodating and service outstanding. The gym was adaquate for a good workout and the concierge had several jogging maps depending on how far I wanted to jog. They even handed me bottled water upon my return. I recommend this hotel for sure.

review.title: sf
review.reviewText: our favorite hotel

review.title: The Best in SF
review.reviewText: The rooms are superb, just right. The bathroom is exquisite. Out does the rest.

review.title: Mandarin Oriental SF Heaven
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived until we checked out, top notch service and comfort. The staff went out of their way to accommodate our every need. I can't wait to go back!!

review.title: Great place to stay while in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. The only thing not satisfied with was the room service and the restaurant.

review.title: View, it's not only the view
review.reviewText: Simply the best hotel in San Francisco. Fantastic view, ideal location (California St.), excellent service. Very satisfying indeed.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Visited to celebrate an anniversary. The services from the concierges were execllent before and during the trip, and the room was very well appointed. Would definitely go back.

review.title: seems like a 3 star hotel...
review.reviewText: the room and elevator is WAY too small for a five star hotel. people at the desk tried to charge the drink that we didn't drink. parking fee is $45 dollars per day...what do you think about it?

review.title: NOT WHAT YOU'D EXPECT
review.reviewText: For the Mandarin's star rating you would expect a lot more. Employees are great but management has a total disregard for their Patron's comfort. Services (such as the lounge) were taken from guests and given to private parties with NO notice or any attempt at another form of satisfaction for guests. Only 2 elevators and one was constantly in repair. The restaurant "Silks" is vastly overrated. Do yourself a favor and go to the Fairmont.

review.title: Fabulous in every way
review.reviewText: Everything was lovely--room decor and comfort. Service top notch--housekeeping put ice in the bucket w/o being asked, front desk, concierge and valet employees all great. Lots of high end hotels claim to have great service but few really do--this one does.

review.title: a room with a view
review.reviewText: beautiful views from the room. very friendly staff. the front desk was a bit small, which made for a little bit of waiting in line, but nothing out of the ordinary.

review.title: Great location...get High floor room...poor/slow service
review.reviewText: Fine except for room service and valet...both slow/confused(ing)and way too expensive! Bar is small and closes early...high-floors are a MUST!

review.title: Almost Right
review.reviewText: New Management and selective upgrades still miss the mark set by other San Francisco five star hotels - come on, can movies on demand be that difficult to provide for one of the City's best known, high end hotels? Just a bit dated and staff that needs time to gel.

review.title: Guaranteed Best View and Personalized Service in SF
review.reviewText: My husband and I planned made our plans to visit Napa Valley. We decided to stay at the Mandarin Oriental because our last stay was very brief and we wanted to enjoy the hotel. One of main reasons why we chose this hotel is for the view. Since the rooms start from the 20-something floor, the view in every room is incredible. From the moment my husband and I stepped out of our car, the wonderful service started. The doorman, the receptionist and the bellhop addressed us by our names. We never had to wait for anything. If one employee was busy, another one stepped in to assist. A few minutes after we settled into our room, complimentary tea and cookies arrived. After traveling, it's a welcomed gesture of hospitality. Our room was beautifully decorated and spectacular view of the city and the bay. We rented a car to get to Napa. The concierge has prepared printed nstructions for every major destination you can possibly want. Getting to Napa and the SF Airport was so simple. We're definitely going to stay at this hotel again!

review.title: A great hotel by any standard.
review.reviewText: Great location. Beautiful views of the city. Well apointed rooms. Fantastic attentative staff. Incredible service.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Was a great hotel with friendly staff. They even catered well to my little Yorkie Lucy Lu. The hotel arranged for us to have a very nice steak dinner as well.We had a wonderful stay.

review.title: Outstanding Hotel
review.reviewText: Awesome view from my room. Very comfortable. Great room service. Concierge service was great.

review.title: luxury, expensive
review.reviewText: luxury, expensive

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with outstanding service. Not inexpensive but you get everything you pay for. This will always be my choice while in San Francisco.

review.title: Best ever
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is 5-star! Best of all was the view fraom the rooms! I have pictures, through the window, with the TransAmerica Building, Coit Tower, and Alcatraz all in one shot. A real treat for tourists!

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: Hotel guests are treated in a very professional manner. The views are great especially on the bay side. Room service was good

review.title: Great Hotel for Business Travellers
review.reviewText: I travel to SF a lot for business and leisure and have always wanted to stay at the Mandarin Oriental. I found the hotel to be top notch! The location is not as great as other hotels around Union Square if you are a leisure traveller. I found it to be on par with other top hotels such as the Park Hyatt.

review.title: expensive but very good
review.reviewText: I thought this was a very solid hotle. its expensive but they generally deliver.

review.title: Best possible
review.reviewText: A perfection in almost every sense. Attention to details are incredible.

review.title: we will stay back if get change
review.reviewText: the best hotel, best service,best dining easy to go shoping

review.title: incredible
review.reviewText: Excellent, very personal service, amazing views, luxurious room.

review.title: First Class
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 4 nights between Christmas and New Year.  From the moment we stepped into the hotel, it was all first rate!  Check in was a breeze, and the staff was Very friendly; while going to the room, we asked the bellman for suggestions of places to eat, he was very accomidating and gave us great suggestions.  Upon arrival to the room, our room service waiter (Simon) brought us complimentary Jasmine Tea (delish!), and a few minutes later, the bellman brought us a computer print out of the places he recommended earlier.  The service was fantastic, and the bed was even better!  We didn't want to get out of it in the am... Soft soft soft!!!  The room was nice.  Decor was very simple, however, we had a king size bay view room, and the extra $$ was well worth it!  The view was worth a million bucks!  Only down-side to the property was it was located in the financial district.  Not too far from everything, however, not right in the hub. All in all, FABULOUS stay, would highly recommend, and visit again!

review.title: Deserving of its reputation
review.reviewText: Service was excellent. Room and amenities were excellent.  Need we say more.

review.title: Best in SF
review.reviewText: Superb

review.title: It is in fact a great hotel
review.reviewText: We were able to obtain a competitive rate for a two night weekend stay.  We felt like we got a big bargain by the end.  We had an infant child with us, and upon checking in, they delivered an infant gift to the room with Diapers, shampoos, powders, etc.  Tea is delivered upon arrival.  The concierge and bell men are truly friendly, and they do remember every guest.  Views from the room are great.  The location is perfect for access to the best shopping and the best restaurants in the City.  Best shower water pressure I have ever experienced.  Very clean room.  In short, the service is what every hotel should strive for.
